SEARCH
Package com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph

Interface Digraph<V,E>

Type Parameters:
V - Type of element stored at a vertex
E - Type of element stored at an edge
All Superinterfaces:
Graph<V,E>, Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DigraphEdgeList
public interface Digraph<V,E> extends Graph<V,E>
A directed graph (or digraph) is a graph that is made up of a set of vertices connected by edges, where the edges have a direction associated with them.
A directed-edge leaves the outbound vertex towards the inbound vertex and this changes the reasoning behind some methods of the Graph interface, which are overridden in this interface to provide different documentation of expected behavior.
See Also:

  • Edge
  • Vertex

  • Method Details

    • incidentEdges

      Collection<Edge<E,V>> incidentEdges(Vertex<V> inbound) throws InvalidVertexException
      Returns a vertex's incident edges as a collection.
      Incident edges are all edges that have vertex inbound as the inbound vertex, i.e., the edges "entering" vertex inbound. If there are no incident edges, e.g., an isolated vertex, returns an empty collection.
      Specified by:
      incidentEdges in interface Graph<V,E>
      Parameters:
      inbound - vertex for which to obtain the incident edges
      Returns:
      collection of edges
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if the vertex is invalid for the graph

    • outboundEdges

      Collection<Edge<E,V>> outboundEdges(Vertex<V> outbound) throws InvalidVertexException
      Returns a vertex's outbound edges as a collection.
      Incident edges are all edges that have vertex outbound as the outbound vertex, i.e., the edges "leaving" vertex outbound. If there are no outbound edges, e.g., an isolated vertex, returns an empty collection.
      Parameters:
      outbound - vertex for which to obtain the outbound edges
      Returns:
      collection of edges
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if outbound is an invalid vertex for the graph

    • areAdjacent

      boolean areAdjacent(Vertex<V> outbound, Vertex<V> inbound) throws InvalidVertexException
      Evaluates whether two vertices are adjacent, i.e., there exists some directed-edge connecting outbound and inbound.
      The existing edge must be directed as outbound --> inbound.
      If, for example, there exists only an edge outbound <-- inbound, they are not considered adjacent.
      Specified by:
      areAdjacent in interface Graph<V,E>
      Parameters:
      outbound - outbound vertex
      inbound - inbound vertex
      Returns:
      true if they are adjacent, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if outbound or inbound are invalid vertices for the graph

    • insertEdge

      Edge<E,V> insertEdge(Vertex<V> outbound, Vertex<V> inbound, E edgeElement) throws InvalidVertexException, InvalidEdgeException
      Inserts a new edge with a given element between two existing vertices and return its (the edge's) reference.
      Specified by:
      insertEdge in interface Graph<V,E>
      Parameters:
      outbound - outbound vertex
      inbound - inbound vertex
      edgeElement - the element to store in the new edge
      Returns:
      the reference for the newly created edge
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if outbound or inbound are invalid vertices for the graph
      InvalidEdgeException - if there already exists an edge containing edgeElement according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.

    • insertEdge

      Edge<E,V> insertEdge(V outboundElement, V inboundElement, E edgeElement) throws InvalidVertexException, InvalidEdgeException
      Inserts a new edge with a given element between two existing vertices and return its (the edge's) reference.
      Specified by:
      insertEdge in interface Graph<V,E>
      Parameters:
      outboundElement - outbound vertex's stored element
      inboundElement - inbound vertex's stored element
      edgeElement - element to store in the new edge
      Returns:
      the reference for the newly created edge
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if outboundElement or inboundElement are not found in any vertices of the graph according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.
      InvalidEdgeException - if there already exists an edge containing edgeElement according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.
